title: Getting last recent block is 0
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `Geth/v1.8.17-stable-8bbe7207/linux-amd64/go1.10`
OS & Version: Linux/OSX

#### Expected behaviour
Always getting the last recent block is 0

#### Actual behaviour
Here is a log
```
INFO [12-19|05:37:46.095] Imported new state entries               count=958  elapsed=36.561ms  processed=71071050 pending=33059 retry=0   duplicate=423 unexpected=1831
INFO [12-19|05:37:46.318] Imported new state entries               count=1267 elapsed=4.109ms   processed=71072317 pending=33241 retry=0   duplicate=423 unexpected=1831
INFO [12-19|05:37:46.341] Imported new block receipts              count=285  elapsed=903.369ms number=5795359 hash=b69b8a…f0fe76 age=6mo6d8h   size=24.87mB
INFO [12-19|05:37:46.542] Imported new state entries               count=957  elapsed=3.791ms   processed=71073274 pending=32380 retry=0   duplicate=423 unexpected=1831
INFO [12-19|05:37:46.594] Imported new block receipts              count=85   elapsed=251.094ms number=5795444 hash=73558c…59dd60 age=6mo6d7h   size=7.91mB
INFO [12-19|05:37:46.737] Imported new state entries               count=1118 elapsed=3.395ms   processed=71074392 pending=32258 retry=2   duplicate=423 unexpected=1831
INFO [12-19|05:37:46.823] Imported new state entries               count=1152 elapsed=5.659ms   processed=71075544 pending=31144 retry=0   duplicate=423 unexpected=1831
INFO [12-19|05:37:47.041] Imported new state entries               count=1338 elapsed=4.954ms   processed=71076882 pending=30968 retry=0   duplicate=423 unexpected=1831
INFO [12-19|05:37:47.334] Imported new state entries               count=1232 elapsed=7.060ms   processed=71078114 pending=31348 retry=0   duplicate=423 unexpected=1831
INFO [12-19|05:37:47.590] Imported new block receipts              count=171  elapsed=728.771ms number=5795615 hash=cad991…2a600c age=6mo6d7h   size=17.32mB
INFO [12-19|05:37:47.630] Imported new state entries               count=951  elapsed=2.217ms   processed=71079065 pending=32890 retry=0   duplicate=423 unexpected=1831
INFO [12-19|05:37:47.696] Imported new state entries               count=1588 elapsed=5.853ms   processed=71080653 pending=31371 retry=2   duplicate=423 unexpected=1831
INFO [12-19|05:37:47.777] Imported new state entries               count=0    elapsed=846.421µs processed=71080653 pending=31251 retry=0   duplicate=433 unexpected=2202
INFO [12-19|05:37:48.000] Imported new block receipts              count=146  elapsed=407.270ms number=5795761 hash=a4a948…45727d age=6mo6d6h   size=15.15mB
INFO [12-19|05:37:48.005] Imported new state entries               count=956  elapsed=2.866ms   processed=71081609 pending=31203 retry=0   duplicate=433 unexpected=2202
INFO [12-19|05:37:48.137] Imported new state entries               count=1296 elapsed=5.912ms   processed=71082905 pending=30848 retry=0   duplicate=433 unexpected=2202
INFO [12-19|05:37:48.294] Imported new state entries               count=1220 elapsed=8.942ms   processed=71084125 pending=29692 retry=0   duplicate=433 unexpected=2202
INFO [12-19|05:37:48.519] Imported new state entries               count=1339 elapsed=9.506ms   processed=71085464 pending=28482 retry=0   duplicate=433 unexpected=2202
INFO [12-19|05:37:48.520] Imported new state entries               count=0    elapsed=31.268µs  processed=71085464 pending=28482 retry=32  duplicate=434 unexpected=2203
```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
So I have started `geth` by the command
`geth --syncmode fast --cache 4096 -rpc`

Having the same problem, get_block return 0, eth.syncing is always 100 blocks behind. The issues started after upgrade to 1.8.23.

OS: Linux - ubuntu
version: {                                                    
  api: "0.20.1",                                              
  ethereum: "0x3f",                                           
  network: "1",                                               
  node: "Geth/v1.8.23-stable-c9427004/linux-amd64/go1.10.4",  
  ...}

> eth.syncing                 
{                             
  currentBlock: 7372263,      
  highestBlock: 7372356,      
  knownStates: 8255718,       
  pulledStates: 8247871,      
  startingBlock: 7372105      
}                             
> eth.blockNumber             
0         

No weird issues in the log, as far as i can tell. Seems to be fetching blocks normally.
Closing because this is a very old issue and the code that handles the sync has changed a lot since this was opened. It is not possible to debug this problem with the information in this issue.
